A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Adam Driver and his scenes are the only redeemable qualities of this movie and still they don't help the audience truly understand his motivations and conflict nearly enough. Dialogue really poor\, jokes contrived and at the wrong time\, secondary (and primary) character development really poor and rushed. Modern day political undertones were very heavy-handed. Felt like Rian was more wrapped up in trying to solve every social ill and compose a modern-day progressive Birth of a Nation than to write a good story and it hurt both his causes.
